טראמפ מורה לזרוע כאוס בבריאות הציבור העולמית https://www.sciencenews.org/article/trump-pepfar-hiv-global-public-healthMeghan Rosen Wed, 29 Jan 2025 20:30:00 +0000Science & Society https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3149540 A recent flurry of executive orders and surprise actions by the Trump administration have roiled WHO, the CDC and the international public health community. 3149540
מרכיבי החיים נמצאו בדגימות של אסטרואיד בנו https://www.sciencenews.org/article/lifes-ingredients-asteroid-bennu-nasaAdam Mann Wed, 29 Jan 2025 16:00:00 +0000Space https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3149474 Samples from NASA’s OSIRIS-REx mission show the asteroid Bennu had organic molecules and minerals and possibly salty water and other life ingredients. 3149474
כך הפכו אמזונאים קדומים לחקלאי תירס מאסטר https://www.sciencenews.org/article/maize-farmers-amazonians-casarabeBruce Bower Wed, 29 Jan 2025 16:00:00 +0000Archaeology https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3149430 Casarabe people grew the nutritious crop year-round on savannas thanks to networks of drainage canals and ponds. 3149430
האם אתה באמת יכול למות מלב שבור? https://www.sciencenews.org/article/heartbreak-death-takotsubo-syndromeBethany Brookshire Wed, 29 Jan 2025 14:00:00 +0000Health & Medicine https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3149352 Death by heartbreak doesn't just happen in stories. In real life, severe stress can cause the sometimes-fatal takotsubo syndrome. 3149352
עטלפים פטפטים נוטים יותר לקחת סיכונים https://www.sciencenews.org/article/bat-vocalization-soceralities- ריכוניםRichard Kemeny Wed, 29 Jan 2025 00:01:00 +0000Animals https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3149419 Bats may broadcast their personalities to others from a distance, new experiments suggest, which could play into social dynamics within a colony. 3149419
רישום זה הוא הסקיצה העתיקה ביותר הידועה של מוח חרקים https://www.sciencenews.org/article/oldest-insect-brain-image-honeybeeTina Hesman Saey Wed, 29 Jan 2025 00:01:00 +0000Life https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3149398 Found in a roughly 350-year-old manuscript by Dutch biologist Johannes Swammerdam, the scientific illustration shows the brain of a honeybee drone. 3149398
כן, אתה יכול להאשים את שינויי האקלים בשורות הבר של LA https://www.sciencenews.org/article/blame-climate-change-la-wildfiresNikk Ogasa Tue, 28 Jan 2025 22:00:00 +0000Climate https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3149451 Weather data show how humankind’s burning of fossil fuels made the hot, dry, windy weather more likely, setting the stage for the Los Angeles wildfires. 3149451
כמו מסלולי זבוב לציפורים, עלינו למפות שחייה לדגים https://www.sciencenews.org/article/flyways-birds-map-swimways-fishStefan Lovgren Tue, 28 Jan 2025 14:00:00 +0000Ecosystems https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3148898 Mapping fish migration routes and identifying threats is crucial to protecting freshwater species and their habitats, ecologists argue. 3148898
צפרדעי קריקט בטן מתפללים את דרכם על פני מים https://www.sciencenews.org/article/cricket-frogs-belly-flop-hop-waterMcKenzie Prillaman Mon, 27 Jan 2025 16:00:00 +0000Animals https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3148852 Cricket frogs were once thought to hop on the water’s surface. They actually leap in and out of the water in a form of locomotion called porpoising. 3148852
אורות צפון לבנים רפאים מציגים מסתורין אורל חדש https://www.sciencenews.org/article/white-northern-lights-auroral-syteryMaria Temming Mon, 27 Jan 2025 14:00:00 +0000Earth https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3148795 These mysterious whitish-gray glows in the northern lights might be cousins of the mauve light streak known as STEVE. 3148795
'פלאטיפוס' קוסמי עשוי לקשר בין שתי תעלומות אסטרונומיות https://www.sciencenews.org/article/platypus-cosmic-flash-black-holeLisa Grossman Fri, 24 Jan 2025 16:00:00 +0000Astronomy https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3148891 A flash of light called the Platypus has hallmarks of a mid-sized black hole shredding a star and a type of burst thought to be a stellar explosion. 3148891
